00001 /*
00002  *******************************************************
00003  *              DOWNSAMPLE A SIGNAL - REDUCES VECTOR SIZE
00004  *******************************************************
00005  *              Tap.Tools Blue Object
00006  *              copyright © 2003 by Timothy A. Place
00007  *
00008  */
00009 
00010 // Check against redundant including
00011 #ifndef TT_DOWNSAMPLE_H
00012 #define TT_DOWNSAMPLE_H
00013 
00014 // Include appropriate headers
00015 #include "tt_audio_base.h"
00016 #include "tt_audio_signal.h"
00017 
00018 
00019 /********************************************************
00020         CLASS INTERFACE/IMPLEMENTATION
00021 
00022         The entire class is implemented inline for speed.
00023  ********************************************************/
00024 
00025 class tt_downsample:public tt_audio_base{
00026 
00027         private:
00028                 tt_attribute_value_discrete     factor;                         // should be a power of 2
00029         
00030         public:
00031                 enum selectors{                                                                         // Attribute Selectors
00032                         k_factor,
00033                 };
00034                 
00035 
00036                 // OBJECT LIFE                                  
00037                 tt_downsample()                                                                 // Constructor          
00038                 {
00039                         set_attr(k_factor, 1);                                                  // default: no upsampling
00040                 }
00041 
00042                 ~tt_downsample()                                                                        // Destructor
00043                 {
00044                         ;
00045                 }
00046 
00047 
00048                 // ATTRIBUTES
00049                 void set_attr(tt_selector sel, tt_attribute_value_discrete val) // Set Attributes
00050                 {
00051                         switch (sel){
00052                                 case k_factor:
00053                                         factor = val;
00054                                         break;
00055                         }
00056                 }
00057 
00058                 tt_attribute_value_discrete get_attr(tt_selector sel)                   // Get Attributes
00059                 {
00060                         switch (sel){
00061                                 case k_factor:
00062                                         return factor;
00063                                 default:
00064                                         return 0;
00065                         }
00066                 }
00067                 
00068                 
00069                 // DSP LOOP - MONO
00070                 void dsp_vector_calc(tt_audio_signal *in, tt_audio_signal *out)
00071                 {
00072                         tt_sample_value temp;
00073                         short                   down_size;
00074 
00075                         temp_vs = in->vectorsize;                       
00076                         while(temp_vs){
00077                                 down_size = factor;
00078                                 
00079                                 while(down_size--){                             // simple SAH technique
00080                                         temp = *(in->vector++);
00081                                 }
00082                                 *(out->vector++) = temp;
00083                                 temp_vs -= factor;
00084                         }
00085                         in->reset(); out->reset();
00086                 }
00087 
00088                 // DSP LOOP - STEREO
00089                 void dsp_vector_calc(tt_audio_signal *in1, tt_audio_signal *in2, tt_audio_signal *out1, tt_audio_signal *out2)
00090                 {
00091                         tt_sample_value temp1, temp2;
00092                         short                   down_size;
00093 
00094                         temp_vs = in1->vectorsize;                      
00095                         while(temp_vs){
00096                                 down_size = factor;
00097                                 
00098                                 while(down_size--){                             // simple SAH technique
00099                                         temp1 = *(in1->vector++);
00100                                         temp2 = *(in2->vector++);
00101                                 }
00102                                 *(out1->vector++) = temp1;
00103                                 *(out2->vector++) = temp2;
00104                                 temp_vs -= factor;
00105                         }
00106                         in1->reset(); in2->reset(); out1->reset(); out2->reset();
00107                 }
00108 };
00109 
00110 
00111 #endif  // TT_DOWNSAMPLE_H
